Class LocationManager

java.lang.Object
  edu.usc.anrg.vsim.discrete.manager.LocationManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocationManagerDB, LocationManagerRandom
public abstract class LocationManager
extends java.lang.Object

An abstract class that defines how a location manager should look like.

Author:
Maheswaran Sathiamoorthy

intersectionTime

public ContactEpisode intersectionTime(LonLat.CartesianPosition p1,
                                       LonLat.CartesianPosition p2,
                                       LonLat.CartesianPosition q1,
                                       LonLat.CartesianPosition q2,
                                       double r,
                                       int t1,
                                       int t2)
Returns the intersection time of two nodes in units of time. For node 1, the initial and starting positions are denoted by p1 and p2 For node 2, they are q1 and q2 The time to go from p1 to p2 is 1 unit of time. The unit does not matter since we are only interested in the fraction of the time unit for which they intersect.

Parameters:
p1 - Initial position of node 1 (t = 0)
p2 - Final position of node 1 (t = 1)
q1 - Initial position of node 2 (t = 0)
q2 - Final position of node 2 (t = 1)
r - The wireless radio range
contactEpisode - Store the start and end contact times
